interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: ER: The Complete Seasons 1-15 [DVD]
Review Date: 2013/08/12
Store: Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Drama
Product Description: ['ER:The Complete Seasons One-Fifteen (15pk/GFT/DVD)', "ER explores the inner workings of an urban teaching hospital and critical issues faced by the dedicated physicians and staff of its emergency room. The pulse-pounding drama features new challenges each season, from exploring personal problems outside of Chicago's County General Hospital to the political issues being raised inside. Each season features new additions, including chief resident Kerry Weaver, Alex Kingston as British surgeon Elizabeth Corday, Paul McCrane as abrasive Dr. Robert Romano, and Lucy Knight (Kellie Martin), a third-year medical student starting her rotation. It’s always rush hour at Chicago’s County General where every day brings triumphs and losses. As Dr. Greene fights his final battle, his former student, John Carter, must step in as Chief Resident to lead the group of healers. Meanwhile, Kovac’s wild ways begin to affect his job performance, Susan Lewis gets married, and Weaver gets promoted. Plus, Carter and Kovac return from their time in Africa.", ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Television', 'Format': 'Box set, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Various', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Number Of Discs': '90', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 9.05 Pounds', 'Item model number': '883929221660', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Box set, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Release date': 'September 13, 2011', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Dubbed': 'Portuguese', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '90'}
Review Text: Loved the show when it was on TV and I still love it.  I am hearing impaired and missed a lot of dialog when it was on so I was looking forward to watching these with the captioning.  Many of the seasons do not have this option.  It's great to watch without commercials!  With so little to watch on TV these days, this has been a real treat for me.  I just wish the captioning wasn't missing on so many seasons.
Review Title: Captions for Hearing Impaired are missing on some.
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
ER: The Complete Seasons 1-15 [DVD]
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Drama
['ER:The Complete Seasons One-Fifteen (15pk/GFT/DVD)', "ER explores the inner workings of an urban teaching hospital and critical issues faced by the dedicated physicians and staff of its emergency room. The pulse-pounding drama features new challenges each season, from exploring personal problems outside of Chicago's County General Hospital to the political issues being raised inside. Each season features new additions, including chief resident Kerry Weaver, Alex Kingston as British surgeon Elizabeth Corday, Paul McCrane as abrasive Dr. Robert Romano, and Lucy Knight (Kellie Martin), a third-year medical student starting her rotation. It’s always rush hour at Chicago’s County General where every day brings triumphs and losses. As Dr. Greene fights his final battle, his former student, John Carter, must step in as Chief Resident to lead the group of healers. Meanwhile, Kovac’s wild ways begin to affect his job performance, Susan Lewis gets married, and Weaver gets promoted. Plus, Carter and Kovac return from their time in Africa.", ']]>']
{'Genre': 'Drama, Television', 'Format': 'Box set, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Various', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Number Of Discs': '90', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 9.05 Pounds', 'Item model number': '883929221660', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Box set, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Release date': 'September 13, 2011', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Dubbed': 'Portuguese', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '90'}
Loved the show when it was on TV and I still love it.  I am hearing impaired and missed a lot of dialog when it was on so I was looking forward to watching these with the captioning.  Many of the seasons do not have this option.  It's great to watch without commercials!  With so little to watch on TV these days, this has been a real treat for me.  I just wish the captioning wasn't missing on so many seasons.
Captions for Hearing Impaired are missing on some.
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference**: Enjoys drama series, particularly long-running television shows that explore medical and social themes.
- **Format Preference**: Favors DVD boxed sets for comprehensive viewing experiences, especially for iconic series that may not be consistently available on modern platforms.
- **Accessibility Needs**: Has a hearing impairment, which significantly influences viewing choices. Prefers content that includes captioning to enhance understanding and enjoyment.
- **Viewing Habits**: Values commercial-free viewing, indicating a preference for binge-watching and uninterrupted engagement with content.
- **Nostalgic Viewer**: Displays a strong emotional connection to past television experiences, indicating that familiarity and nostalgia play a role in their entertainment choices.
- **Critical Engagement**: Reviews include constructive feedback about content accessibility, demonstrating a keen awareness of the importance of inclusive features in media. 

Overall, this user is an avid fan of drama television, particularly medical dramas, with specific requirements for accessibility features to enhance their viewing experience.
